plot_events.plot: Dan Castellaneta, the voice of Homer in The Simpsons, provides the voice of Beelzebot, the robot Devil. When Fry and Leela open the door to "Robot Hell", in the bottom right side of the screen there is a heart with an arrow through etched on the wall, reading "H.S 4 M.B", meaning Homer Simpson 4 Marge Bouvier, from The Simpsons.
This is the first appearance of the Robot Devil.

The skit when Leela duels Robot devil in a fiddle contest is based on the song "The Devil Went Down to Georgia" by Charlie Daniels Band, in which the devil challenges a boy named Johnny to a fiddle contest and if Johny won he would get a solid gold fiddle.
The symbol for the Church of Robotology welded onto Bender is the schematic for a resistor - presumably a reminder to "resist" the temptations of sin.
Behind the altar it says '10 SIN 20 GOTO HELL' which is a BASIC language computer program.
The title is a paraphrase of "Hell Is Other People", from the 1944 Existentialist play "Huis Clos" by Jean-Paul Sartre
Preacherbot's cleric bears a strong resemblance to Humorbot 5.0, who appears a couple seasons later.
You can actually see a crate with the label "Replacement Robot Legs" beside the meeting table after Bender was unstuck from the ship.
This episode is one of four featured in the Monster Robot Maniac Fun Collection, reflecting its popularity with both fans and the creators of Futurama.
When the crew travel to Sicily 8, the mob planet, Fry receives the kiss of death. This is a reference to The Godfather Part II
The Robotology preacher, who has his first appearance in this episode, is modelled after the reverend Jesse Jackson.
Professor Farnsworth refers to Oprahism as a current mainstream religion. This is a clear allusion to Oprah Winfrey, the TV superstar and richest woman in the world.

Hookerbot 5000 is a reference to Late Night with Conan O'Brien's Pimpbot5000. Pimpbot5000 is described as "combining the classic styling of a 1950's robot with the dynamic flair of a 1970's street pimp".
In Atlantic City, Bender stays in a hotel called Trump Trapezoid. This is an allusion to the Trump Organization and its famous hotels.
Fry's line "Tonight, we're gonna party like its 1999" is from the Prince song 1999.
Robot Hell is reminiscent of the robot holding area in Star Wars Episode VI: Return of the Jedi when C-3PO and R2-D2 are in Jabba's palace and see several Droid being tortured.
The hornets that shoot rings of lasers at the escaping Bender, Fry, and Leela are very similar to the robotic hornets located in the Asteroid Belt of Star Fox 64.
The "Hallelujah" chorus is played during the crew's escape from Robot Hell.
"A reference is made to the Coalsack Nebula, a nebula often mentioned in Star Trek.

actors.bio: Born in Detroit, Michigan, in 1968. Attended St. Matthew Elementary, Bishop Gallagher High School. He then went on to business school at Wayne State University for two years. In 1988 Danny transferred to the University of Arizona. He graduated as a musical theatre major. Worked in Regional theaters across the country...

name: Hell is Other Robots

role_events.blurb: Wretched sinner unit! The path to robot heaven lies here ...  ... in The Good Book 3.0.
I see a lot of fancy robots here today, made of real shiny metal. But that don't impress the Robot Devil, no, sir!
'Cause if you're a sinner, he's gonna plug his infernal modem in the wall, belchin' smoke and flame. And he's gonna download you straight to Robot Hell!
So I ask you: Who will stand up and be saved? Who? Who?
We are gathered here today to deliver brother Bender from the cold, steel grip of the Robot Devil unto the cold,acherbot welds the symbol of Robotology, a resistor symbol, to Bender's chest.]
Me?
In fact, that's why we loved you.
This is a witch hunt!
Oh, yeah.
Drop!  Ow! How's it going?  Enjoying the show? Ow!   Don't forget to pick up a T-shirt!
Oh, my...
Peace, we out!
Aw! Oh, yeah!
Could you hold my purse for a minute?
Greetings, Bender! Welcome to Robot Hell.
No, Bender. Robot Hell is quite real. Here's our brochure.
Sorry, Bender, you agreed to this when you joined our religion. If you .
We know all your sins, Bender. And for each one we've prepared an agonising and ironic punishment. Gentlemen?
Gambling's wrong and so is cheating, So is forging phoney IOU's, Let's let Lady Luck decide, What type of torture's justified, I'm pit boss here on level two!
Ooh! Deep-fried robot!
Please read this 55-page warrant.
We've checked around, there really aren't.
t of the Beastie Boys. The Robot Devil picks Bender up by the leg and shakes him. CDs fall out of his chest cabinet.]
Selling bootleg tapes is wrong, Musicians need that income to survive.
You'll pay for every crime, Knee-deep in electric slime, You'll suffer till the end of time, Enduring torture's, most of which rhyme, Trapped forever here in Robot Hell!
Of course, that's just for starters.
Sorry, but I hold all the cards here. There's nothing I can do. Now, if you'll justl as a solid gold fiddle.
Well it's mostly for show.
You'll only win a smaller, silver fiddle. Also I guess I'll kill one of you, uh, him.
Very well, then. Beat this.
Your turn.
Stop them! They cheated!
Ladies and gentlemen, here to lay down some old, old, incredibly old school beats: The Beastie Boys!
Tellin' you all it's a...
Sabotage, yeah!
Y'know, we're really not that interested in meeting them.
That was a thousand years ago. Now we got seven.
Hey, Bender!
Not anymore, baby. I'm with the band!
Hey, fellas, hey. I want you to meet my friends, Bender, Fry and Leela.
Hey, Bender, why don't we ditch these organ sacks and hit the real party?
Don't be a drag, man. We're jacking on!  Aw, yeah!  Wanna jolt?
Come on, Bender, grab a jack. I told these guys you were cool.
Easy, baby. You don't wanna get hooked on this stuff.

Well now don't you tell to smile, You stick around,, I'll make it worth your while Got numbers beyond what you can dial, Maybe it's because I'm so versatile, Style profile I said, It always brings me back when I hear Wu Child...
...known for the Flintstone Flop Tammy D gettin' biz on the crop, Beastie Boys know to let the beat...
Sabotage!
Hey, Bender, gonna make some noise, With your hard drive scratched by the Beastie Boys! That's whatcha, whatcha, whatcha get on level five!
Counter indicated!
It's a mirage...
No, sir!
Straight to hell!
Good morning, Bender.
What's his problem?
Oh, yeah.
Would monsieur care to see the wine list?
Hey, sailing unit!
Live a little.
Can I get anybody a beer?
I believe that qualifies as ill. At least from a technical standpoint.
Hey, Fender! Man, I haven't seen you since high school. You still workin' at Jack In The Box?
Count me in! I'm gonna drink till I reboot!
Hey, what kinda party is this? There's no booze and only one hooker.
Uh, hey, I'm no square but isn't that counter-indicated by my operations manual?
Well, if jacking on'll make strangers think I'm cool, I'll do it!
Eh, no need to worry. I don't have an addictive personality.
Shut up, square!  I'll just be a minute!
Hey! Do I preach to you when you're lying stoned in the gutter? No! So beat it!
Your mama! Now shut up and drag me to work!
None of your business! Get off my back!
No! Don't come in!
Alright, let's get to work! I'll be out in a second.
None of your business! Get off my back!
A what kind of disturbance?
Come on, universe, you big, mostly empty wuss! Gimmie all the juice you got!  Oh, mama!
What?
You're right. I'm a lost cause.
Maybe there's another way.
Oh, yeah, that's the good stuff.   What am I doing? What have I become? Huh?
Me.
Oh, what a beautiful morning, Oh what a beautiful day!  Greetings, friends. Don't we all look nice today? Frw stare, shocked.]
Wonderful. Then you'll all come to my exceedingly long, un-air-conditioned baptism ceremony!
Uh, while you're at it, could you touch up this seam?
The old Bender's gone. He won't trouble you anymore.
No poison for us, thanks. I'll stick with good old mineral oil.  Ah! Functional!
Yes.  But first, since I love you all so much, I'd like to give everyone hugs. Come here, Fry!
Mmm! Mmm! Fry, you're my friend!  Come on, everyone line up for a hug. Let's tear down some emotional walls.
Sanacquaint him with a little thing called "sleaze".
I can't believe somebody hired an interstellar spaceship to deliver a package to Atlantic City. What are we delivering anyway?
Where are we delivering it to?
Another job well done. Now back to the office for an enjoyable evening of fasting and repentancusly fortified.
Thou shalt not snatch.
Stop tempting me! For once in my life I have inner peace.
Well...
I'm the greatest.  Woo-hoo!

Y'know, as a major Hollywood director, I'll be holding auditions tonight for my next movie. And even though you're all young and naive, I think you might just have what it takes.  Hey! I'm trying to score here! Can't you read the "Do Not Disturb" sign?  No! No!
I'm hallucinating this, right?
But I don't belong here. I don't like things that are scary and painful.
Aw, crap, singing. Mind if I smoke?
Just tell me why.
There must be robots worse than I.
Then please let me explain, My crimes were merely boy-ish pranks.
No! Oh, they're tormenting me with up-tempo singing and dancing.
Well, we're boned.
I could if you'd drop the stupid gold violin!
Don't worry, guys, I'll never be too good or too evil again. From now on, I'll just be me.
I don't know. Do you think you could survive a 700ft fall?
This is awesome! I've been waiting a thousand years to see a Beastie Boys show.
Sure!
Will you guys shut up! I'm trying to look cool.
Wow! An old-fashioned mosh pit! Come on, guys. Tonight we're gonna party like its 1999 ... again.
Man, these guys rock harder than ever!
Wow! I love you guys! Back in the 20th century, I had all five of your albums.
Cool! Can I borrow the new ones? And a couple of blank tapes?
Hey, uh, Bender? What are we doing in this bad neighbourhood?
Who was that guy?
Bender? No way!  I definitely would've noticed something.
I know Big Vinnie said he was giving me the kiss of death but I still think he was gay.
A little.  You OK, Bender?
What's happening? I-I feel weird!

And you made me feel like a jerk for trusting you. Just like when my friend Richie swore he wasn't taking drugs and then he sold me my mom's VCR and then later I found out he was taking drugs. You make me ashamed to be your friend.
Religion? Is this another scam to get free yarmulkes?
Does that mean we can eat now?
Oh, uh, but I don't want to.
And there's Hookerbot 5000. She's got a heart of solid gold!
Pfft! That's for losers. C'mon, sin your heart out.
Go for it, Bender. You know you wanna!
Look's like we got the old Bender s hotel room.]

Actually--
I don't feel well.
Bender, are you alright?

No. Do you?
Good old Bender!
Our electric bill's climbing faster than a green snake up a sugar cane. Obviously someone round been wastin' a whole heap a juice! Probably you!
And as a further cost-cutting measure, I have eliminated the salt-water cooler.
Oh, yes!
Mon, I'm hungrier thapse. The staff have given up praying and anxiously wait for Bender to finish.]
Good news, everyone! Today you'll be delivering a crate of subpoenas to Sicily 8, the Mob Planet!
Yes.
Impressive. They're busting mad rhymes with an 80% success rate.
Ow! Hey, watch it!
If I didn't know better I'd almost think he was abusing electricity.
Bender, why are you spending so much time in the bathroom? Are you jacking on in there?
Did he use his tongue?
Uh-oh. There seems to be some sort of electrical disturbance in the Coalsack Nebula.
Electrical. Anyway, it's going to take some careful piloting to avoid it.
We're out of control. We're heading straight into the electric field!
Bender, we didn't mind your drinking, or your kleptomania, or your pornography ring.
But this electricity abuse crossed the line. You almost killed us.
Give him a break, Fry. If this helps Bender clean up his act then I think we should be supportive.
This is unbelievable. The old Bender never would have taken us out to dinner.
What are you doing to my ship?
Hey, Bender, look at that woman's purse. It's hanging by a spaghetti strand.
Go nuts.
Who would've thought hell would really exist? And that it would be in New Jersey!
It's up to us tofights, Publishing indecent magazines,
Alright, Beelzebot, what'll it take to get our friend back?
Do you know how to play the fiddle?
No, but I used to play the drums. They're sorta similar.  What happens if we lose?
We'll do it.
Hurry, Bender!
Oh, sorry.
Uh, do you think you could be just little less evil than that.

summary: Bender joins a robot church after fighting an addiction to electricity, but reverts to his pre-addictive behavior of cigars, booze and robot hookers, leading to a musical confrontation with the Robot Devil. Written by Jeff Lindstrom.
